TutorStepData.name: Step 1:
TutorStepData.description: To create a new ISO file, you must select a creation type.

TutorStepData.name: Step 1:
TutorStepData.description: Select the 'Carrier', 'Vehicle', 'Small (3x5x3)'.

TutorStepData.name: Step 2:
TutorStepData.description: Select a cockpit and place it in the scene, then activate the mirror tool to place 4 tires.

TutorStepData.name: Step 3:
TutorStepData.description: You can change the orientation of the tires in here. Hit 'Apply' to take effect.

TutorStepData.name: Step 4:
TutorStepData.description: Some parts can be hidden when you export your creation.

TutorStepData.name: Step 5:
TutorStepData.description: You can select more than one part by pressing "shift". When multiple parts are overlapping, you can left-click to select occluded objects.

TutorStepData.name: Step 1:
TutorStepData.description: Switch to the material tab, double-click on a material icon to edit. UID is a material number generated by the program, you can find it in the folder. Your friend can use it as well.

TutorStepData.name: Step 2:
TutorStepData.description: The materials (up to 16 types)numbered in the material tab are the list of materials used in the scene. Select a material. When you mouseover the top-right corner of the icon, 'delete' will appear.

TutorStepData.name: Step 3:
TutorStepData.description: Here we will create a new material. Click the¡°Create New material¡± button, you can adjust the material properties in this UI. Choose your own picture and put its path in the 'Diffuse' textbox. You can also specify a bump map in the box below. (The picture must be of PNG type and smaller than 128x128). Hit 'Create' when ready.

TutorStepData.name: Step 4:
TutorStepData.description: Select 'Wood' in the Matter textbox to list all materials that are made of wood.

TutorStepData.name: Tips:
TutorStepData.description: Mirroring can make building much faster. The tool can mirror axis or axis planes, and is applicable to building, selecting, painting and other operations. Experimenting with it can help you understand the differences.

TutorStepData.name: Step 1:
TutorStepData.description: Click the selection tool. When mouseover any surface, the contact point will change its color based on the direction the surface is facing.

TutorStepData.name: Step 2:
TutorStepData.description: Use the 'UP' and 'DOWN' arrow keys to adjust the depth of the selection.

TutorStepData.name: Step 3:
TutorStepData.description: You can use a material to fill up the selection.

TutorStepData.name: Step 4:
TutorStepData.description: When you have any selection, hold 'Shift' + the arrow keys/'page up'/'page down' to extrude the selection.

TutorStepData.name: Tips:
TutorStepData.description: You can make complex selection by holding 'Shift'/'Alt'/'Control'. They function as adding, substracting, cross-selecting, respectively.

TutorStepData.name: Step 1:
TutorStepData.description: Select a color in the color picker, adjust the brush opacity, strength, hardness, then paint the small car.

TutorStepData.name: Step 2:
TutorStepData.description: Use the selection tool to create a selection, see the result after clicking the 'fill color' button in the inspector.

TutorStepData.name: Step 1:
TutorStepData.description: Click the ¡°Save¡± button in the lower right menu bar to bring up the save window. You can specify the background color of the icon. Choose a different angle for the snapshot by rotating the camera in the backstage. You need to press 'F10' or the 'Capture' button to finalize the look of the icon.

TutorStepData.name: Step 2:
TutorStepData.description: The ISO tab will list local ISO files. By default, the ISOs are grouped by its creation type in their respective folders. You can create your own folder to store your ISOs.

TutorStepData.name: Step 1:
TutorStepData.description: Click the Export button in the right-bottom corner to bring up the export interface. It shows your creation info, resource costs and problems if it had any. When everything is ready before export, export will see the items in the inventory.

TutorStepData.name: Path -
TutorStepData.description: Players can share their ISO files and custom materials with other players. The ISOs can be found in '[FFFF00]My documents/PlanetExplorers/VoxelCreationData/[-]' There are 3 folders in the path: '[FFFF00]My documents/PlanetExplorers/VoxelCreationData/[-]'

TutorStepData.name: Materials -
TutorStepData.description: the materials folder. The file name is a program-generated number (UID).

TutorStepData.name: Creations -
TutorStepData.description: Here stores the creation data files. When sharing game saves with other players, you need to include all the creation data files associated with the game save. The creation data files are named after a system generated value. The file names can be found by viewing the creation item in player's inventory in game.

TutorStepData.name: Isos -
TutorStepData.description: Here stores the creation data files. When sharing game saves with other players, you need to include all the creation data files associated with the game save. The creation data files are named after a system generated value. The file names can be found by viewing the creation item in player's inventory in game.

TutorStepData.description: Change direction when drawing some shapes.

TutorStepData.description: Select multiple parts and selection.

TutorStepData.description: Substract selection.

TutorStepData.name: [FFFF00]Ctrl[-] -
TutorStepData.description: Cross selection.
